titleStmt.title: Declamationum excerpta according to codex Bernensis 149 (A) 9. An electronic transcription.
titleStmt.author: Calpurnius Flaccus

availability.licence: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/.

msIdentifier.msName: Bongars, Jacques: Sammelbd. Jurisprudenz, lat., franz., dt.

msContents.summary: The manuscript contains various items of type juridical (1-17), and medical or alchemical (18-23). It includes Pseudo-Quintilian's second major declamation (item 8).

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation 1-479; the correct foliation is written on the upper right corners, rectos, in pencil (the foliation bottom right is obsolete).

history.provenance: Whereabouts: France/Germany (in possession of Jacques Bongars)

listBibl.bibl: Full manuscript description on the Burgerbibliothek online catalogue:

msItem.author: Calpurnius Flaccus
msItem.title: Declamationum excerpta
msItem.incipit: Incipiunt ex Calpurnio Flacco excerptae. Uxor tyrannicida. Quinque cum Tyranno
msItem.explicit: Amo enim iuvenem, quem non genui, sed redemi. Finis.

supportDesc.foliation: Besides the foliation of the whole manuscript, the Calpurnius item has its own foliation from f. 2 to f. 16 on the upper right corners, rectos, very close to the written text. f. 16 is also foliated on the verso.

layoutDesc.layout: All pages have 28 written lines, except f. 251r (29 lines) and f. 259r (30 lines).

handDesc.handNote: Unidentified hand that wrote most of manuscript. It is not the hand of Jacques Bongars or Pierre Daniel, who both wrote other parts of the manuscript.
Corrections by first hand or another hand.

listBibl.bibl: Description of item 9 in the Burgerbibliothek Bern online catalogue: .

char.desc: Sign >> in the margin, indicating probably a passage of interest to a reader.

char.charName: LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH OGONEK
char.desc: The character ę (e caudata) has no standard mapping. The ę can be resolved in 'ae' in most cases, but also in 'oe' or 'e'.

div.ab:
uxor tyrannicida.
Quinque cum tyranno familiae proximaeproximae familiae, puniI
antur. Quaedam, quae habebat duos filios, & tyrannum
virum, tyrannicidium fecit: praemio impunitatem liberis po
stulavit, meruit. Ex his alter. occupavit arcem. At eum
mater occidit. Petit alteri impunitatem. Contradicitur.
contra matrem.
Occidam inquit. Quanta nobis patienda sunt, dum occide
rit Tyrannum Foeemina possit, & mater velit Non
possum mortem filii mei videre. Hoc est ergo quare illum
velimus occidere!
pars altera
petit praemium, non quod accipiat, sed quod accepit.

tin1st t in tinguntur corrected? Difficult to read.
guntur

add.w: indicareHand clearly different from N1 and from other corrections.

ab.w: malaeI think N1 reads malae, Håkanson reads mala.e

hi.w: cruciariar-iar- added by N2 and then deleted by N2 or N3.ius
